title: Serie A news: Mauro Icardi backs Romelu Lukaku to shine at Inter Milan
text:
Mauro Icardi insists there are no hard feelings towards Inter Milan and has backed Romelu Lukaku to score 'so many goals' for his former side.

The Argentina international left the Serie A side under a cloud after he was frozen out by manager Antonio Conte, which saw him join Paris Saint-Germain on a season-long loan earlier this summer.

In his place, Inter signed Lukaku from Manchester United for £73million, all but bringing Icardi's time at the club to an end.

Mauro Icardi has backed Romelu Lukaku to score 'so many goals' in his place at Inter Milan

The Argentine left the Serie A side under a cloud to join PSG on a season-long loan

Lukaku started the new campaign strongly for Inter, too, scoring three goals in his first four Serie A games but has since struggled to find the back of the net in his last three matches.

However, Icardi insists Lukaku will settle in soon enough and get back to scoring goals for the Nerazzurri.

'I don't think Lukaku is experiencing any problems,' Icardi told Gazzetta dello Sport. 'Indeed, I think he started well, scoring a couple of goals right away.

'He then got injured like me and maybe that brought about the usual criticism, but it's not easy for anyone to play in Italy. He'll settle in and score so many goals.'

Following a strong start to life at Inter, Lukaku hasn't found the back of the net in three games

Icardi also wished his former side the best of luck for this season.

He added: 'I can only wish the best for Inter in every competition. I still have many friends in Milan. With Conte, it can be a good year for the Scudetto.'

The forward acrimoniously left Inter earlier this summer following a high-profile contract dispute with the club last season.

Icardi was banished from training by the Italian side but then reinstated after a move to Juventus fell through - only to seal a late loan on transfer deadline day.

In 219 games for Inter, Icardi scored 124 goals since joining from Sampdoria in 2013.
